features.description: When not wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.
You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for unarmed strikes and monk weapons, and you can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action after attacking with a monk weapon.
You gain a pool of Ki points equal to 1 per monk level
After you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 Ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.
You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.
You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action on your turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.
Your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.
Choose a monastic tradition (Way of the Open Hand, Way of the Shadow, or Way of the Four Elements) that grants you additional features.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1. Or choose a feature.
You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
You can spend 1 Ki point to attempt to stun a creature you hit with a melee weapon attack.
Your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
You can use your action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be charmed or frightened.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1. Or choose a feature.
Your speed increases by an additional 10 feet.
Gain a feature based on your chosen monastic tradition.
You can now attack three times instead of twice whenever you take the Attack action.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1. Or choose a feature.
Gain another feature based on your chosen monastic tradition.
You gain proficiency in all saving throws, and when you make a saving throw, you can spend 1 Ki point to reroll it.
Gain another feature based on your chosen monastic tradition.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1. Or choose a feature.
You no longer age, and you can spend 1 Ki point to regain hit points.
You can use 4 Ki points to become invisible and gain resistance to all damage except force damage.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1. Or choose a feature.
When you roll for initiative and have no Ki points remaining, you regain 4 Ki points.
